required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on April 13, 2016
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Clinical Evaluation of Two New Silicone Hydrogel Multifocal Products
clinical_study.official_title: Clinical Evaluation of Two New Silicone Hydrogel Multifocal Products

brief_summary.textblock: The objective of this trial is compare the visual performance, ratings, and preference of two multifocal, soft contact lenses.

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Intervention Model: Crossover Assignment, Masking: Single Blind (Subject), Primary Purpose: Treatment

primary_outcome.measure: Corrected Distance Binocular Visual Measurement in Normal Illumination Reported as Binocular Distance Visual Acuity
primary_outcome.description: Tested while reading charts distant to the subject with both eyes together in normal lighting. This outcome is measured in logMAR units (logarithm of the minimum angle of resolution). A logMAR acuity of 0.0 equates to 20/20 Snellen acuity and is considered normal. Positive logMAR values indicate poorer vision and negative values denote better visual acuity.

arm_group.description: Lotrafilcon B, followed by Senofilcon A
Senofilcon A, followed by Lotrafilcon B

intervention.description: Silicone hydrogel, soft, multifocal contact lens
Silicone hydrogel, soft, multifocal contact lens

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Be at least 35 years of age
- Best-corrected distance visual acuity of at least 20/40 in each eye.
- Spectacle add between +0.75D and +1.50D (inclusive).
- Able to be fit in available study sphere powers (-1.00 to -5.00D)
- Currently wearing soft contact lenses at least 5 days a week.
- Other protocol inclusion/exclusion criteria may apply.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Eye injury or surgery within twelve weeks immediately prior to enrollment.
- Currently enrolled in an ophthalmic clinical trial.
- Evidence of systemic or ocular abnormality, infection or disease likely to affect successful wear of contact lenses or use of their accessory solutions.
- Any use of medications for which contact lens wear could be contraindicated as determined by the investigator.
- Astigmatism â‰¥ 1.00D.
- Currently wearing either of the study products.
- Other protocol inclusion/exclusion criteria may apply.

participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: One participant was enrolled but not dispensed due to failing inclusion/exclusion criteria. This participant is included in the Actual Enrollment calculation, but not Participant Flow or Baseline Characteristics calculations.

group.title: Lotrafilcon B / Senofilcon A
group.description: Lotrafilcon B multifocal contact lenses worn first, with Senofilcon A multifocal contact lenses worn second. Both products worn in a daily wear basis.

group.title: Senofilcon A / Lotrafilcon B
group.description: Senofilcon A multifocal contact lenses worn first, with Lotrafilcon B multifocal contact lenses worn second. Both products worn in a daily wear basis.

participants_list.participants: One participant discontinued between Period 1 and Period 2 due to lack of efficacy.
Two discontinuations between P1 & P2: 1 for fail inc/exc criteria; 1 for lack of efficacy.

group.title: Overall
group.description: This reporting group includes all enrolled and dispensed subjects.

outcome.title: Corrected Distance Binocular Visual Measurement in Normal Illumination Reported as Binocular Distance Visual Acuity
outcome.description: Tested while reading charts distant to the subject with both eyes together in normal lighting. This outcome is measured in logMAR units (logarithm of the minimum angle of resolution). A logMAR acuity of 0.0 equates to 20/20 Snellen acuity and is considered normal. Positive logMAR values indicate poorer vision and negative values denote better visual acuity.
outcome.population: Per Protocol. Analysis excluded major protocol deviations as determined by masked review.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: For a period of 10 years, the clinical investigator must hold all trial-related information and documents confidential and must agree to obtain sponsor's written consent before discussing, presenting, publicizing, or otherwise disclosing any pre-clinical and/or clinical data or impressions from this trial.

point_of_contact.name_or_title: Priya Janakiraman, OD, FAAO / Head, Global Clinical Affairs
